p: DENV detection methods include virus culture, which is time consuming [ 17, 18] as well as ELISA or immunofluorescence methods to detect IgM and IgG which suffer from cross-reactivity to other flaviviruses antibodies and which are only considered valid when antibody titers are sufficiently high [ 19]. The introduction of NS1 antigen detection has improved the situation and recent studies show a high sensitivity of NS1 detection [ 50], with some concluding that the combination with IgM detection can outperform PCR [ 51]. However, its use for routine screening in dengue epidemics is questioned in terms of clinical necessity [ 52].
